    "patch": "@@ -16,7 +16,7 @@ ms.custom: it-pro\n The new bulk operations experience in Microsoft Entra ID provides enhanced capabilities for managing **Groups** and **Devices**. This service enables bulk actions including create, update, and delete operations. The improved service delivers better performance, reduces timeouts, and removes scaling limitations for large tenants.\n \n > [!NOTE] \n-> The new bulk operations service currently only supports **Groups**, **Devices**, and **Users** export. Support for additional entities like **Enterprise applications** will be added in a future update.\n+> The new bulk operations service currently only supports **Groups**, **Devices**, and **Users** export. Support for additional entities like **Enterprise applications** will be added in a future update. Localization for templates is not supported.\n \n For information about limitations and to learn more about the previous Bulk Operations experience, see [Bulk operations service limitations](bulk-operations-service-limitations.md).\n \n@@ -168,4 +168,4 @@ You can bulk export users following the steps in [Download a list of users in Mi\n \n - [Bulk operations service limitations](bulk-operations-service-limitations.md)\n - [Add or remove group members using Microsoft Entra ID](how-to-manage-groups.yml)\n-- [Bulk create users in Microsoft Entra ID](../identity/users/users-bulk-add.md)\n\\ No newline at end of file\n+- [Bulk create users in Microsoft Entra ID](../identity/users/users-bulk-add.md)"

    "sha": "dc526f1d9b5b80d531760829b5f3c107d8dd6322",

    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 7,

    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/e8aedff1da64b2a8b39bad359451c03725ceeda5/docs%2Fidentity%2Fdomain-services%2Freference-domain-services-tls-enforcement.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fdomain-services%2Freference-domain-services-tls-enforcement.md?ref=e8aedff1da64b2a8b39bad359451c03725ceeda5",
    "patch": "@@ -8,7 +8,7 @@ ms.assetid: 6b4665b5-4324-42ab-82c5-d36c01192c2a\n ms.service: entra-id\n ms.subservice: domain-services\n ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 08/15/2025\n+ms.date: 09/03/2025\n ms.author: justinha\n ms.reviewer: bochingwa\n ms.custom: has-azure-ad-ps-ref, azure-ad-ref-level-one-done\n@@ -21,13 +21,18 @@ Microsoft Entra Domain Services supports TLS versions 1.0 and 1.1, but they're d\n \n You can use the Azure portal or PowerShell to enable **TLS 1.2 Only Mode**.\n \n+## Prerequisites\n+\n+You need the [Application Administrator](../role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#application-administrator) and [Groups Administrator](../role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#groups-administrator) roles in Microsoft Entra ID to change security settings such as **TLS 1.2 Only Mode**.\n+\n ## Identify applications that use deprecated TLS versions\n \n Before you enable **TLS 1.2 Only Mode**, it's important to identify applications that still use TLS 1.0 or 1.1, and update them or replace them with alternatives that support TLS 1.2. For more information about apps that are expected to be impacted, see [TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1 deprecation in Windows](/windows/win32/secauthn/tls-10-11-deprecation-in-windows).\n \n ## [**Azure portal**](#tab/portal)\n \n-1. In the Azure portal, search for **Domain Services**, and select your Domain Services instance. \n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as an [Application Administrator](../role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#application-administrator) and a [Groups Administrator](../role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#groups-administrator).\n+1. Search for **Domain Services**, and select your Domain Services instance. \n 1. Select **Security Settings**.\n 1. If **TLS 1.2 Only Mode** is set to **Disable**, the instance enables TLS versions 1.0 and 1.1. Set **TLS 1.2 Only Mode** to **Enable**, and then click **Save**.\n "

    "patch": "@@ -1,7 +1,7 @@\n ---\n title: What's new in Microsoft Entra application management\n description: This article shows the new and updated documentation for the Microsoft Entra application management.\n-ms.date: 08/06/2025\n+ms.date: 09/03/2025\n ms.service: entra-id\n ms.subservice: enterprise-apps\n ms.topic: whats-new\n@@ -16,6 +16,14 @@ manager: mwongerapk\n \n Welcome to what's new in Microsoft Entra application management documentation. This article lists new docs and those articles that had significant updates in the last three months. To learn what's new with the application management service, see [What's new in Microsoft Entra ID](~/fundamentals/whats-new.md).\n \n+## August 2025\n+\n+\n+### Updated articles\n+\n+- [Manage app consent policies](manage-app-consent-policies.md) - Revised for technical accuracy\n+\n+\n ## July 2025\n \n ### Updated articles\n@@ -31,9 +39,3 @@ Welcome to what's new in Microsoft Entra application management documentation. T\n - [Configure how users consent to applications](configure-user-consent.md) - Added clarity on authorization policies and app consent policies\n \n \n-## May 2025\n-\n-### Updated articles\n-\n-No updates this month.\n-"

    "sha": "b889b4e3ddad5369d7a7fc1dde62ffbd853ec521",
    "filename": "docs/identity/hybrid/connect/how-to-connect-install-prerequisites.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 2,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 2,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/e8aedff1da64b2a8b39bad359451c03725ceeda5/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-install-prerequisites.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/e8aedff1da64b2a8b39bad359451c03725ceeda5/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-install-prerequisites.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-install-prerequisites.md?ref=e8aedff1da64b2a8b39bad359451c03725ceeda5",
    "patch": "@@ -68,6 +68,8 @@ To read more about securing your Active Directory environment, see [Best practic\n     - You must configure TLS/SSL certificates. For more information, see [Managing SSL/TLS protocols and cipher suites for AD FS](/windows-server/identity/ad-fs/operations/manage-ssl-protocols-in-ad-fs) and [Managing SSL certificates in AD FS](/windows-server/identity/ad-fs/operations/manage-ssl-certificates-ad-fs-wap).\n     - You must configure name resolution. \n     - You'll need either an account with the global administrator role or an account that has the [hybrid identity administrator](../../role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#hybrid-identity-administrator) and the [domain name administrator](../../role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#domain-name-administrator) roles.  The configurations related to federation require permissions that the [hybrid identity administrator](../../role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#hybrid-identity-administrator) currently doesn't have but the [domain name administrator](../../role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#domain-name-administrator) role does.\n+      > [!NOTE]\n+      > For the installation and configuration of Microsoft Entra Connect, the global administrator or hybrid identity administrator role must be assigned directly to the user. These roles can't be granted through group membership\n - It isn't supported to break and analyze traffic between Microsoft Entra Connect and Microsoft Entra ID. Doing so could disrupt the service.\n - If your Hybrid Identity Administrators have MFA enabled, the URL `https://secure.aadcdn.microsoftonline-p.com` *must* be in the trusted sites list. You're prompted to add this site to the trusted sites list when you're prompted for an MFA challenge and it isn't yet added. You can use Internet Explorer to add it to your trusted sites.\n - If you plan to use Microsoft Entra Connect Health for syncing, you need to use a Global Administrator account to install Microsoft Entra Connect Sync. If you use a Hybrid Identity Administrator account, the agent is installed but in a disabled state. For more information, see [Microsoft Entra Connect Health agent installation](how-to-connect-health-agent-install.md)."

]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response: This update focuses on documentation improvements and corrections. It clarifies that the new bulk operations service in Microsoft Entra ID currently supports exports for Groups, Devices, and Users, with support for additional entities like Enterprise applications to be added later, and notes that template localisation is not supported. Additionally, it updates the date for several documentation articles and refines the prerequisites for enabling TLS 1.2 Only Mode for Microsoft Entra Domain Services, specifying the required roles. It also adds a note regarding the direct assignment of roles for Microsoft Entra Connect installations and general documentation clean-ups.
